result.title: Week #7
result.content:
Hello everyone,

Here's the content of the last session:

The first problem we talk about was Princess Farida: http://www.spoj.com/problems/FARIDA/

We solved different versions of it, here are the solutions:

https://ideone.com/Vai95y

https://ideone.com/jyS5Z1

https://ideone.com/NUMAbz

Another example was Fibonacci sequence :https://ideone.com/1gAlu5, check this problem: https://a2oj.com/p?ID=150

Then we talked about the Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS) and solved it with three different implementations:

https://ideone.com/SIeDpz, https://ideone.com/J6RQLi, and https://ideone.com/0ul1TG.

The other classical problem was Longest Common Subsequence, we also talked about how to print the optimal solution in DP problems. But before that here is the code for checking if string B is a subsequence of string A: https://ideone.com/yyJnbI

LCS code: https://ideone.com/j4zMvD

Longest Palindrome Subsequence: https://ideone.com/KMgXEh

The last problem was about finding the maximum sum from the top-left cell to the bottom-right cell: https://ideone.com/jyXo34

Additional Problems from other online judges

https://a2oj.com/p?ID=157

http://www.spoj.com/problems/TRIKA/

Resources:

Dynamic Programming â€“ From Novice to Advanced: https://www.topcoder.com/community/data-science/data-science-tutorials/dynamic-programming-from-novice-to-advanced/

Dynamic programming: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynamic_programming

Good luck!
